intro: Ecbolium wynaadense, commonly known as the Wynaad ecbole, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
